byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and JOSH KRON
byline.contributor: Mohamed Ibrahim contributed reporting from Mogadishu, Somalia, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: American officials say they were surprised by Kenya's armed incursion into Somalia to battle Islamist militants; Kenya is one of closest American allies in Africa and American officials have branded Somali militant group Shabab as serious threat to United States.
snippet: Kenya’s sudden incursion into Somalia over the weekend caught the United States by surprise, American officials said.
lead_paragraph: Kenya’s sudden incursion into Somalia over the weekend caught the United States by surprise, American officials said.

headline.main: Kenya Reportedly Didn’t Warn U.S. of Somalia Incursion
headline.print_headline: Officials Say U.S. Had No Warning of Kenya’s Somalia Incursion
